input_text:
Job Title: Electromagnetic Laboratory Lead

Location: Winter Garden, Florida, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Electromagnetics Laboratory Lead 

 Be the Difference 

Astrion offers comprehensive services that boost preparedness, optimize performance, and ensure success across various domains, from Cyber to Digital, Mission and Systems, servicing our nation's Civilian, Defense and Space communities. We support customers with Centers of Excellence in Washington DC, Huntsville, AL and Burlington, MA with an additional 36 locations across the U.S.

Astrion has an exciting opportunity for an Electromagnetic Laboratory Section Lead for the LASSO II contract, supporting the Space Division, at Kennedy Space Center in Merritt Island, FL. This position may require occasional overtime including weekend work depending on tasks. Shift work may be required.

JOB DETAILS

The ideal candidate is an experienced technical or engineering manager responsible for overseeing the electromagnetics laboratory at the Kennedy Space Center, would have experience in electromagnetic interference testing, effective operations and testing leadership, and operations and maintenance experience with complex electronic test equipment. Knowledge and skills in electromagnetic interference test methods, test automation, and demonstrated strength in leadership and management of test tasks and test teams. This is a fulltime position and work will be performed onsite at the Kennedy Space Center.

LOCATION: Kennedy Space Center, Florida

JOB STATUS: Fulltime

TRAVEL: None

Required Qualifications / Skills

 Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, physics, mathematics, or other technical discipline.  Ten or more years of technical and leadership experience (Engineer V)  Twelve or more years of technical and leadership experience (Engineer VI)  Current U.S. Citizenship is required. 

Desired Qualifications / Skills

 Excellent communication, presentation and customer interface skills required  Ability to work effectively and cooperatively in a team environment.  Must be able to coordinate and prioritize work between multiple projects or tasks without missing deadlines or sacrificing accuracy.  Knowledge of test and measurement laboratories and electromagnetic compatibility/electromagnetic interference (EMC/EMI) testing practices  Knowledge of RF measurements and the electromagnetic spectrum  Ability to assess and calculate measurement uncertainty for various standard and newly developed test processes  Experience and knowledge in administering Safety, Quality, Property requirements and an understanding of financial management and Government/Contractor relations.  Knowledge of KSC practices and procedures  Must be self-motivated, demonstrate initiative, and be able to work independently or with minimal supervision after initial training.  Competent in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook) and SharePoint. 

Responsibilities

 Manage and direct all Electromagnetics Laboratory activities  Coordinate technical activities with laboratory engineers and laboratory technicians  Act as the technical interface to Government and non-Government customers  Perform technical analysis of policies and customer requirements  Provide technical support for the development of test plans and analysis, schedules, estimates, budgets, and reports.  Provide technical support for the development and tracking of contract technical and performance metrics  Provide technical support for the development, implementation, and maintenance of risk management plans  Ensure the safety of personnel and equipment  Identify and grow high potential employees 

What We Offer

 Competitive salaries  Continuing education assistance  Professional development allotment  Multiple healthcare benefits packages  401K with employer matching  Flexible time off (FTO) along with a federally recognized holiday schedule 

Who We Are

At Astrion, we innovate, elevate, and shape the world of tomorrow. At our core is our purpose to “Be the Difference”. This means we encourage our employees to take action and be the driving force for positive change. We foster an environment where innovative solutions flourish and our company continuously evolves.

We have a culture of care, empathy, and making a tangible difference within our organization and communities. We embrace continuous learning, growth, and innovation, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. We promote collaboration and empowering our teams is at the core of our success.

Join Astrion and Be the Difference in your career and the world!

Astrion is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
